cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the theory of formal languages and automata, which is a core topic in computer science. The paper discusses logical and algebraic characterizations of rational transductions, which are functions that map words to words. This topic is closely related to formal language theory and automata theory, which are covered in the sub-categories cs.FL and cs.DS. The paper also discusses the use of logical and algebraic methods to characterize rational transductions, which is related to the sub-categories cs.LO and cs.IT. Finally, the paper discusses the complexity of deciding whether a rational transduction is aperiodic, which is related to the sub-category cs.CC.
